title: الاخْتِصَاص
description: Learn about الاختصاص, a grammatical construction that specifies who is meant after a pronoun, as in نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ نُكْرِمُ الضَّيْفَ (We Arabs honor the guest).

notes.title: What is الاخْتِصَاص?
content: الاختصاص is a grammatical construction where a noun in the accusative case follows a pronoun (usually first person نَحْنُ or أَنَا) to specify and clarify who is meant by that pronoun.
This construction adds emphasis and specificity. In نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ نُكْرِمُ الضَّيْفَ, the word الْعَرَبَ specifies that 'we' refers specifically to Arabs, distinguishing them from others.
keyPoints: الاختصاص = specifying who is meant by a pronoun
The noun (الْمُخْتَصّ) is in the accusative case

examples.english: I, the student, respect the teacher

notes.title: Types of the Specified Noun
content: The الْمُخْتَصّ (specified noun) can take three forms: (1) a noun with أل (the definite article): نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ, (2) a noun in إضافة (genitive construction): نَحْنُ مَعْشَرَ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ, or (3) أَيُّهَا/أَيَّتُهَا followed by a noun.
The third type (أَيُّهَا) is used when addressing oneself or a group with emphasis: نَحْنُ أَيُّهَا الْمُسْلِمُونَ. Note that أَيُّهَا remains in the nominative as it is مبني.
keyPoints: أَيُّهَا is مبني على الضم in this construction

examples.english: We, the group of prophets, are not inherited from
We youth are the hope of the nation
I, the mother, sacrifice for my children

notes.title: Grammatical Parsing of الاختصاص
content: The الْمُخْتَصّ is parsed as مفعول به لفعل محذوف وجوبًا (object of an obligatorily omitted verb). The estimated verb is أَخُصُّ or أَعْنِي (I specify/I mean).
The full estimated meaning of نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ نُكْرِمُ الضَّيْفَ is: نَحْنُ أَخُصُّ الْعَرَبَ نُكْرِمُ الضَّيْفَ (We - I specifically mean the Arabs - honor the guest).
keyPoints: المختص: مفعول به منصوب لفعل محذوف
The pronoun (نَحْنُ/أَنَا) is parsed normally in its sentence

examples.arabic: نَحْنُ الْعَرَبَ: الْعَرَبَ مفعول به منصوب
examples.english: الْعَرَبَ is accusative object of omitted أَخُصُّ

examples.arabic: نَحْنُ مَعْشَرَ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ: مفعول به مضاف

notes.title: Difference from البدل and Usage
content: الاختصاص differs from البدل (apposition) in that البدل follows the case of what it replaces, while الاختصاص is always accusative. Also, البدل can follow any pronoun, while الاختصاص typically follows first person pronouns.
This construction is used for emphasis, pride, or to distinguish a group. It appears in Hadith: نَحْنُ مَعَاشِرَ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ لَا نُورَثُ (We prophets are not inherited from).
keyPoints: الاختصاص always accusative; البدل follows case
الاختصاص usually with 1st person; البدل with any
الاختصاص emphasizes group identity or distinction
Common in Hadith and classical literature

examples.english: We prophets are not inherited from (Hadith)
Follow us, the people of Islam
